body: Thank you for reporting: does sound like a bug.

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

body:
Hmmmh. I can easily reproduce this... but need to think of how to properly fix it -- `TreeTraversingParser` is not in position to access necessary configuration.

Problem comes from `JsonParser.getValueAsInt()` from `ParserMinimalBase` calling `getIntValue()` which has stricter cheks -- this because `TreeTraversingParser` does not implement `getValueAsInt()` unlike concrete "real" parsers.

rename.from: Jackson 3: TreeTraversingParser does not respect ACCEPT_FLOAT_AS_INT

issue.title: chore: Upgrade to Jackson 3.0.1 and remove workaround

repository.name: hilla
repository.description: Build better business applications, faster. No more juggling REST endpoints or deciphering GraphQL queries. Hilla seamlessly connects Spring Boot and React to accelerate application development.

issue.body:
- Remove float-to-int coercion workaround methods from EndpointInvoker
- Remove TreeTraversingParser limitation comments and logic
- Update Jackson version from 3.0.0-rc9 to 3.0.0-rc11
- Issue https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/5319 is fixed in Jackson 3.0.0-rc11

issue.title: `DeserializationFeature.ACCEPT_FLOAT_AS_INT` not respected for byte/short when deserializing from JsonNode

repository.name: jackson-databind
